definition: to close/to shut
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
surname Guan
to close/to stop up/to shut/to obstruct

sentences.english: When finished with the list, click OK then close out of Local Group Policy Editor.
sentences.chinese: 完成列表後，點擊確定並關閉本地組策略編輯器。

sentences.english: The toner cartridge engages when the door is closed.
sentences.chinese: 蓋門關閉後，硒鼓將鎖定就位。

sentences.english: The sprinklers will remain off when it rains.
sentences.chinese: 下雨的時候，灑水器會自動關閉。

sentences.english: And Rinpoche has vowed to turn off the water while brushing his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 仁波切本身則誓言在刷牙時要關閉水龍頭。

sentences.english: The bladder is thin-walled and closed by a one-way valve.
sentences.chinese: 浮囊具有薄壁的結構並且通過單方向的閥門關閉。

sentences.english: Now we have a vending machine that we can turn on and off.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們有了一臺可以開啓和關閉的自動售貨機。

sentences.english: Keep valves closed when cylinders are not in service or empty.
sentences.chinese: 當鋼瓶沒有使用或是空瓶的時候，保持閥門關閉。

sentences.english: Close public restaurants, lounges and shops.
sentences.chinese: 關閉公共餐廳，酒廊和商店。

sentences.english: Flooding forced the closure of manufacturing plants in Ayutthaya, according to news reports.
sentences.chinese: 據新聞報道，洪水已迫使大城府的製造工廠關閉。

sentences.english: BGM or turn it or any other sounds of the game off.
sentences.chinese: 如果你想改變BGM或關閉遊戲中的聲音就走過去。
關閉閘門將是非常困難的。

sentences.english: Added an option to turn off smoke and dust off the tank tracks.
sentences.chinese: 增加了可以關閉坦克行駛時的煙霧和揚塵的選項。

sentences.english: Unlike ROM, RAM chips lose their data once power is shut off.
sentences.chinese: 不像羅，一旦失去他們的數據片公權力關閉。

sentences.english: All needle valves must be closed on test kit.
sentences.chinese: 檢測組件上的所有針形閥都必須關閉。
關閉非重要的空氣進口。

sentences.english: The chain reaction that actually runs the reactor can be shut off in a matter of seconds.
sentences.chinese: 實際運行反應堆的鏈式反應可以在數秒左右被關閉。

definition: to suspend/time-out (e.g. in sports)/stoppage/pause (media player)
to enter/to join/to go into
to blockade/to seal off
to delay/to postpone/to keep putting sth off/to procrastinate/(computing) to lag
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
to open/to show (a ticket)/to turn on/to switch on
to stop/to terminate (law)
to depart/to leave
temporary/provisional/for the time being
as the time draws near/at the last moment/temporary/interim/ad hoc
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
to permit/to allow
to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
auxiliary verb introducing future action: may (be able to)/will (cause)/should (enable)/going to
